pack in.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to do a lot in a limited period of time, or fit a lot of information, ideas etc into a limited space
pack in.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: We packed a lot of sightseeing into two weeks.
In an essay of 2,000 words, you can pack a lot in.
pack in.translation[0].definitions[1].de: if a film, play etc packs people in, it attracts large numbers to come and see it
pack in.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Any film starring Tom Cruise always packs them in.
pack in.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to stop doing a job or activity that you are not enjoying
pack in.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: After one year, I packed in university.
Sometimes I feel like packing it all in and going off travelling.
pack in.translation[0].definitions[3].de: used to tell someone to stop doing something that is annoying you
pack in.translation[0].definitions[4].de: if a machine packs in, it stops working because there is something wrong with it
pack in.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: Halfway to the airport, the engine packed in.
